intro: Amoria glomerata, commonly known as the clustered amoria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to red. The plant is native to parts of Australia and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. Amoria glomerata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
